tool.name: ProteinInference
tool.description: Protein inference based on an aggregation of the scores of the identified peptides.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && mkdir ${' '.join(["'in/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in) if f])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in/%s/%s.%s' && " % (f, i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in) if f])} mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in ${' '.join(["'in/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in) if f])} -out 'out/output.${out_type}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: input file(s)
output file type
If your idXML contains multiple runs, merge them beforehand
param.help: Otherwise performs inference separately per run

param.label: Additionally calculate the target-decoy FDR on protein-level after inference
If true, adds a map_index MetaValue to the PeptideIDs to annotate the IDRun they came from
Force merging of disagreeing runs
Minimal number of peptides needed for a protein identification
param.help: If set to zero, unmatched proteins get a score of -Infinity. If bigger than zero, proteins with less peptides are filtered and evidences removed from the PSMs. PSMs that do not reference any proteins anymore are removed but the spectrum info is kept

param.label: How to aggregate scores of peptides matching to the same protein?
If this is true, different charge variants of the same peptide sequence count as individual evidences
If this is true, different modification variants of the same peptide sequence count as individual evidences
If this is true, shared peptides are used as evidences
param.help: Note: shared_peptides are not deleted and potentially resolved in postprocessing as well

param.label: If this is set, peptide counts won't be annotated at the proteins
If this is true, calculates and annotates indistinguishable protein groups
If this is true, shared peptides will be associated to best proteins only
Use (D+1)/(T) instead of (D+1)/(T+D) for reporting protein FDRs
Use picked protein FDRs
If using picked protein FDRs, which decoy string was used
If using picked protein FDRs, was the decoy string a prefix or suffix
Overrides tool-specific checks
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Protein inference based on an aggregation of the scores of the identified peptides.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/nightly/html/TOPP_ProteinInference.html
